messages: f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:02): How do i change encoding in vim?
bba19c8fdf9e2d72367608858395e9cf (19:05): guerra: I'd be very happy to know it too :)
35cd51ccd493b67542201d20b6ed7db9 (19:06): try :set fileencoding=(utf8|latin1)
a8770bdd2580944a790167ad5da192a3 (19:11): vim7 seems to have a problem regarding cmdheight

f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:11): did not solve my problem......i have a file that i made in a system with utf8 encoding.....when i open here with utf8 as encoding or latin  it does not show the ?ß ?© ?° chars, only ? in its place
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:13): I have gvim7.0 on Windows XP and when I put http://pastebin.com/765215 in my _vimrc file I don't have syntax highlighting and other cool vim features
a8770bdd2580944a790167ad5da192a3 (19:13): i tried a minimal .vimrc containing set nocompatible and set ch=1
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:13): my _vimrc file from my home directory (from the windows profile dir)
a8770bdd2580944a790167ad5da192a3 (19:13): but only when i source it the commandline gets set to a height of 1 not on startup
a8770bdd2580944a790167ad5da192a3 (19:15): so does anyone have an id which default config file overrides my ch=1 setting?
35cd51ccd493b67542201d20b6ed7db9 (19:15): guerra: probably a problem with locales or font selection then
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:15): if it was a font problem when i type teh characters they wouldnt appear right?
a8770bdd2580944a790167ad5da192a3 (19:16): (would be nice to hear if my question even got noticed...)
a6af29dc5df2b24efb0c6d14ffb6f23a (19:16): Harzilein: :verbose set ch? will tell you who changed
a6af29dc5df2b24efb0c6d14ffb6f23a (19:16): s/$/ it
a6af29dc5df2b24efb0c6d14ffb6f23a (19:16): Harzilein: this is irc, be patient
a8770bdd2580944a790167ad5da192a3 (19:17): aah, i see it's my distribution's fault
a8770bdd2580944a790167ad5da192a3 (19:17): avlondono: thx
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:22): how do I install my vimrc for (Fedora 4) vim 6.3 on Windows vim 7?
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:22): plz, someone help me! this encoding thing is pissing me off!
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:23): guerra: what does ":set fenc? tenc? enc?" say?
c3c31ae67404d89834d5432b28c5e99f (19:24): christi: %USERPROFILE% probably
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:24): christi: :he vimrc
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:27): sry jamessan
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:27): it didnt work
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:27): jamessan, rixxon: why the http://pastebin.com/765215 vimrc deactivates syntax highlighting on windows vim7?
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:29): jamessan, rixxon: on vim6.3 on Fedora4 it works fine
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:29): christi: it doesn't deactivate it. it never activates it.  on Fedora, the syntax highlighting is probably enabled in the system-wide vimrc
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:29): christi: you probably want to add 'syntax on' to your vimrc
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:30): jamessan: if I delete the _vimrc file on windows the syntax is on
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:31): even the simple presence of an empty _vimrc file deactivates syntax highlighting
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:32): I think if the use _vimrc file exists vim doesn't look at the system-wide config file anymore
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:34): jamessan i have no idea of what i should do...
eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:34): jamessan: it needs to be named _gvimrc
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:34): guerra: how did that command not work?
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:34): christi: it shouldn't need to be
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:34): jamessan: it didnt work, can u send it again plz?
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:35): :set fenc? tenc? enc?
5d98197b9d13e89c6aea160c19c3027a (19:35): hmm when I open certain files I have indents at the start that I can't remove what are those? and how do I get rid of them?
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:36): ruskie: do you mean there are lines where you can't put your cursor in column 0?
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:36): jamessan: it says option not supported
5d98197b9d13e89c6aea160c19c3027a (19:36): it's annoying as hell
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:36): ruskie: those are tab characters
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:37): ruskie: if you ":set list" you'll see them

eb65c814e09276640de113edc48457e3 (19:37): jamessan: at least it works :) can you tell me your opinion on my this vimrc file: http://pastebin.com/765215 ; is it missing something? should I use something else instead of <<autocmd FileType tcl>> ?
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:37): guerra: what version of Vim are you using?
5d98197b9d13e89c6aea160c19c3027a (19:37): hmm set list is nice...
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:38): guerra: ah! it seems like your Vim wasn't compiled with multi_byte support
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:38): ruskie: especailly when you use ":set lcs+=tab:>-"
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:38): how do i set that option when compiling?
5d98197b9d13e89c6aea160c19c3027a (19:39): ohhh I see tabs now... great idea...
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:40): guerra: "./configure --help" shows that you would specify --enable-multibyte when configuring

5d98197b9d13e89c6aea160c19c3027a (19:40): as there anything that I can use to convert tabs in an opened file to spaces? so that I can get rid of tabs in files I don't want... not automaticaly though..
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:40): ruskie: :he :retab
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:40): thanks man!
b2e596b0f012f2ba257a87f5baf4b850 (19:46): I want to substitute double with long double, how can I avoid getting a recurscion like: long long long ... double
f473d080a3249808cc4df4439d33eeb4 (19:48): jamessan: many thanks worked perfectly now!!!!! :D
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:48): guerra: you're welcome :)
b2e596b0f012f2ba257a87f5baf4b850 (19:52): jamessan: for testing I tried u\@!d which shouldn't match ud, but it does.
b2e596b0f012f2ba257a87f5baf4b850 (19:55): seems like it is difficult and tricky as the help says.
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (19:55): Zvpun: you'd want u\@<!d for that
b2e596b0f012f2ba257a87f5baf4b850 (19:55): seems like what I try is not allowed
b2e596b0f012f2ba257a87f5baf4b850 (19:58): jamessan: thanks
